intro: Dryas punctata var. kamtschatica, commonly known as the Kamtschatica stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its dense, fleshy leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates with limited growing seasons. This variety is often used in rock gardens and as a hardy ornamental plant in colder regions.
